entry.title: How to consume s4 hana public cloud SOAP Outbound Service in CPI for replication
entry.content:
Hii Community,

Can someone help me out how to configure my Sender(S4 Public Cloud) and Consumer(CPI) system to replicate production order data from S4 to MES System through CPI?

I got replication SOAP service from api.sap.com which needs to be activated in SAP. Let me know if someone has done this kind of integration.

I appreciate your attention on question

Regards,

Omkar

entry.title: How to Export Analytical Model Output from SAP Datasphere to Azure Data Lake Storage?
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

I am working on a requirement where I need to export the output of an Analytical Model in SAP Datasphere into Azure Data Lake Storage (ADLS).

Connections to both Datasphere and Azure are already established.

Question:
Is there a way to export Analytical Model data into ADLS?

I attempted to create a Replication Flow with Datasphere as the source. However, when selecting the source object, I only see:

  • Local Tables

  • Fact Views

  • Dimension Views

The Analytical Models do not appear as selectable source objects.

Has anyone implemented this scenario or knows if Analytical Models are supported in Replication Flows or if there is an alternative approach?

Thanks in advance!

 

SAP Datasphere Cloud Integration Cloud Connector

entry.title: How to set trigger for Integration Suite for periodic 1st Tuesday but except holiday.
entry.content:
Hi I‚Äôm wondering how to set periodic timer event for Integration Suite.

That condition is trigger the iFlow in every month every week in certain day but except national holiday or company holiday.

I found a similar case in SAP community in following link.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-integration-suite-advanced-scheduler-configuration/ba-p/13564143 

But I need to do more for customers request for restricting the trigger for national holiday or company holiday.

Please somebody give me your knowledge for guiding me for this area.

Thank you for in advance.

Sincerely 

T.N

entry.title: Alert Retry Mechanism
entry.content: Im having a scenario where I will send data to target via mail so that if any error occurs in the iflow it should retry that error. When the error is resolved in the iflow it should automatically stop the retry and process and it needs to send data to the target via mail.

entry.title: MDI to Planon Integration delta token not matching
entry.content:
We've recently established connection with Planon with S4 HANA Public Cloud. We've managed to push/pull some data.

Then I've tried to set up the BP resulting to recreating the MDI service instance.

After updating the credentials of impacted config, we can no longer sync to Planon. Planon says they are getting a delta token not matching error. They already tried restarting their app but still no go.

2025-12-10 17:23:48,100 [ERROR] [pnlog.APP.planonsoftware.com.planonrealestatemanagementforsap.servermodule.com.planon.sap.scheduledtask.SyncVersionIdsTask] Exception occured while executing SyncVersionIdsTask: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}} : com.planonsoftware.platform.backend.connector.v2.MessageDiscardException: SyncService-BTP response Code: 400, message: {"error":{"code":"DeltaTokenDoesNotMatchRequest","message":"The consuming system or requested entity type and version does not match the delta token. Please only use delta tokens in the context of one consuming system, entity type and version.","details":[]}}

What can we do with this issue?

entry.title: SAP Integration Cell support
entry.content:
We are deploying Rancher to manage the Kubernetes cluster where the SAP Integration Cell will be hosted. According to the documentation, SAP requires Rancher as a prerequisite to manage the cluster; however, there is no mention of any requirements related to the virtualization layer.
 
Could you please confirm whether there are any requirements at the hypervisor layer from SAP‚Äôs perspective to manage Rancher and Kubernetes? Specifically, is VMware ESXi required, or is it also possible to use a KVM-based hypervisor? As far as we checked,  "The hypervisor is considered out of scope from SAP perspective"

entry.title: SAP Integration suite SFTP Sender adapter archiving function is not working - Submitted to SAP
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

 We are using an SFTP sender to pick up files from the server and then move them to an archive folder. Currently, the file pickup is working fine, but the files are not being moved to the archive folder. Because of this, the same file is getting processed multiple times. I have checked the folder permissions, and all folders have read, write, and execute access. I am attaching a screenshot of the SFTP configuration.

entry.title: Trading Partner Management in SAP Integration Suite: ANSI X12 EDI Integration
entry.content:
Introduction

Trading Partner Management (TPM) in SAP Integration Suite enables enterprises to manage B2B integrations with partners using standards like ANSI X12. It provides a centralized way to define partner profiles, agreements, connectivity, certificates, and mappings, ensuring smooth exchange of EDI documents with SAP backend systems via IDocs.

 

Step 1: Company Profile

  • Define your own organization in TPM.
  • Include identifiers such as DUNS number, GLN, or custom IDs.
  • This profile represents your company in all agreements.

 

Step 2: Partner Profile

  • Create a profile for each trading partner.
  • Capture identifiers (ISA/GS segments in ANSI X12), contact details, and communication channels.
  • Profiles standardize partner metadata for reuse across agreements.

 

Step 3: Agreements

  • Agreements connect your company profile with a partner profile.
  • Define:
    • Transaction sets (ANSI X12 types).
    • Protocols (AS2, SFTP).
    • Certificates for encryption/signing.
  • Agreements govern how messages are exchanged, validated, and acknowledged.

 

Step 4: Connectivity (AS2 & SFTP)

  • AS2: Configure partner endpoint, certificates, MDN settings, and encryption/signature algorithms.
  • SFTP: Define host, port, authentication (password or SSH key), and inbound/outbound directories.
  • Connectivity ensures secure, reliable transport of EDI files.

 

Step 5: Certificates

  • Upload partner public certificates for AS2 encryption/signing.
  • Maintain your own private/public key pairs.
  • Monitor expiry dates to avoid disruptions.

 

Step 6: Mapping

  • Use Integration Advisor or Cloud Integration to map ANSI X12 transaction sets to SAP IDocs.
  • Example: X12 810 (Invoice) ‚Üí INVOIC02 IDoc.
  • Mapping ensures semantic consistency between external EDI formats and SAP internal structures.

 

Common ANSI X12 Transaction Sets and SAP IDoc Types

| ANSI X12 Transaction Set | SAP IDoc Type | Functionality |
|--------------------------|---------------|---------------|
| 850 ‚Äì Purchase Order | ORDERS05 | Customer purchase orders |
| 810 ‚Äì Invoice | INVOIC02 | Supplier invoice processing |
| 856 ‚Äì Ship Notice/Manifest | DESADV05 | Shipment and delivery notifications |
| 820 ‚Äì Payment Order/Remittance Advice | PEXR2002 / REMADV01 | Payment instructions and remittance advice |
| 940 ‚Äì Warehouse Shipping Order | SHPMNT05 | Warehouse shipment details |
| 945 ‚Äì Warehouse Shipping Advice | SHPMNT05 | Confirmation of goods shipped |
| 997 ‚Äì Functional Acknowledgment | CONTRL | Acknowledgment of EDI messages |
| 844 ‚Äì Product Transfer Account Adjustment | GSVERF01 | Adjustments in product accounts |
| 832 ‚Äì Price/Sales Catalog | PRICAT01 | Exchange of product price catalogs |
| 830 ‚Äì Planning Schedule with Release Capability | DELFOR02 | Forecast of deliveries |
| 846 ‚Äì Inventory Inquiry/Advice | INVRPT01 | Inventory reporting |

 

Additional Considerations

  • Message Implementation Guidelines (MIGs): Define partner-specific rules for each transaction set.
  • Monitoring: Use TPM dashboards to track message flows, acknowledgments, and errors.
  • Migration: Existing SAP PI/PO EDI scenarios can be migrated to TPM using Integration Advisor.
  • Compliance: Ensure mappings align with SAP Note 104606 for ANSI X12 compatibility.

 

Conclusion

By configuring company profiles, partner profiles, agreements, connectivity, certificates, and mappings, enterprises can seamlessly integrate ANSI X12 EDI flows with SAP IDocs in Integration Suite. TPM reduces onboarding complexity, enforces compliance, and accelerates B2B integration projects.

entry.title: ü§ñ Tutorial: How to use Gemini AI to Debug SAP CPI Errors Automatically
entry.content:
ü§ñ Tutorial: How to use Gemini AI to Debug SAP CPI Errors Automatically ü§ñ

 

Body: Why settle for cryptic stack traces? I recently built a custom Exception Subprocess in SAP Integration Suite that catches failures and asks Google's Gemini AI to explain them in plain English.

Here is the exact step-by-step configuration I used to build the "CPI-GEMINI" flow:

Step 1: The Exception Subprocess Strategy I moved the error handling logic out of the main process into a dedicated Exception Subprocess. This ensures that any failure in the main "Happy Path" immediately triggers this recovery logic.

Step 2: Constructing the AI Prompt (Content Modifier) To talk to the API, we need to format the request perfectly. I used a Content Modifier with two key parts:

Headers: Set Content-Type to application/json and Authorization to your Google API Key.

Body: This is where the magic happens. I wrapped the standard ${exception.message} variable inside the required Gemini JSON schema: {"contents": [{"parts":[{"text": "In cpi iflow following error encounter:${exception.message}"}]}]}.

Step 3: Calling the Model (HTTP Adapter) I used the standard HTTP Receiver adapter to POST the payload to the Gemini 2.5 Flash endpoint.

Address: https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/gemini-2.5-flash:generateContent

Method: POST.

Step 4: Handling the Response (JSON to XML & Filter) The AI response is a large JSON object. To extract just the answer:

JSON to XML Converter: I converted the response and added a custom root element named root.

Filter: I used an XPath expression to drill down to the exact text node: /root/candidates/content/parts/text.

Step 5: Logging the Insight (Groovy Script) Finally, I used a simple Groovy script to grab the filtered AI explanation and attach it to the Message Processing Log (MPL).

Code: messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("Error_Body_Payload", body, "text/plain").

The Result: Instead of just seeing "System Error," the monitoring log now contains an attachment where Gemini explains the likely cause of the failure based on the error context.

 



 



 

https://generativelanguage.googleapis.com/v1beta/models/gemini-2.5-flash:generateContent?key={YOUR_API_KEY}

 



 



 



 






<xs:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" xmlns:xs="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema">
  <xs:element name="root">
    <xs:complexType>
      <xs:sequence>
        <xs:element name="candidates">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element name="content">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element name="parts">
                      <xs:complexType>
                        <xs:sequence>
                          <xs:element type="xs:string" name="text"/>
                        </xs:sequence>
                      </xs:complexType>
                    </xs:element>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="role"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element type="xs:string" name="finishReason"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:float" name="avgLogprobs"/>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element name="usageMetadata">
          <xs:complexType>
            <xs:sequence>
              <xs:element type="xs:byte" name="promptTokenCount"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:short" name="candidatesTokenCount"/>
              <xs:element type="xs:short" name="totalTokenCount"/>
              <xs:element name="promptTokensDetails">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="modality"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:byte" name="tokenCount"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
              <xs:element name="candidatesTokensDetails">
                <xs:complexType>
                  <xs:sequence>
                    <xs:element type="xs:string" name="modality"/>
                    <xs:element type="xs:short" name="tokenCount"/>
                  </xs:sequence>
                </xs:complexType>
              </xs:element>
            </xs:sequence>
          </xs:complexType>
        </xs:element>
        <xs:element type="xs:string" name="modelVersion"/>
      </xs:sequence>
    </xs:complexType>
  </xs:element>
</xs:schema>
import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import com.sap.it.api.msglog.MessageLogFactory

def Message processData(Message message) {
    // 1. Access the Message Log
    def messageLog = messageLogFactory.getMessageLog(message)
    
    // 2. Get the current Body as a String
    // This captures whatever payload is currently in the flow (Error response or Request)
    def body = message.getBody(String.class)
    
    if (messageLog != null) {
        // 3. Attach it to the Monitoring Log
        // "Error_Body_Payload" is the name of the link that will appear in the Monitor
        if (body != null && !body.isEmpty()) {
            messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("Error_Body_Payload", body, "text/plain")
        } else {
            messageLog.addAttachmentAsString("Error_Body_Payload", "Body was empty.", "text/plain")
        }
    }
    
    return message
}

Safa

entry.title: SAP CI integration with Cloud ALM monitoring
entry.content:

we will be using SAP Cloud ALM in the future (as successor for Solution Manager), among other tasks also for system and interface monitoring. How would you plan the implementation, which stakeholders would you involve and which challenges do you see? Please also give an outlook for additional ideas which you see as worthwhile for improving Integration Suite monitoring and operations.

Regards, 

Ramu.

entry.title: Trading Partner Management: Indentification problems
entry.content:
Hello Colleagues,

I'm exploring the first time with SAP Integration Advisor - TPM configuration and I'm struggling to make the aggremment generate a correct trading partner ID reflect the reallity, after active the agreement, look the configuration below:

I'm testing the SOAP cenario Inbound in SAP CPI and I created the soap envelop with flat-file of ODETTE EDIFACT A96 S3 ORDERS:

Manually created SOAPEnvelop with FLAT FILE CDATA:

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:n0="http://sap.com/xi/SAPGlobal20/Global">
    <soapenv:Header/>
    <soapenv:Body>
        <n0:PurchaseOrderERPRequest_In>
            <MessageHeader>
                <ID>MSG_ODETTE_2026_999</ID>
                <CreationDateTime>2026-01-14T12:00:00Z</CreationDateTime>
                <SenderParty>
                    <InternalID schemeID="N/A" schemeAgencyID="ZZ" schemeAgencyName="ODETTE_EDIFACT">EXT.EDI</InternalID>
                </SenderParty>
                <RecipientParty>
                    <InternalID schemeID="N/A" schemeAgencyID="" schemeAgencyName="SAP">SAP</InternalID>
                </RecipientParty>
                <BusinessScope>
                    <TypeCode>PROCESS_ID</TypeCode>
                    <InstanceID>ODETTE_D96A_S3</InstanceID>
                </BusinessScope>
            </MessageHeader>
            <PurchaseOrder>
                <Payload>
                    <![CDATA[UNA:+.? '
UNB+UNOA:2+EXT.EDI:ZZ+SAP+260114:1830+REF12345'
UNH+1+ORDERS:D:96A:UN:S3'
BGM+220+PO999888777+9'
DTM+137:20260114:102'
PAI+:::42'
FTX+ZZZ+1++INSTRUCTIONS'
RFF+ON:4500001234'
NAD+BY+ID007::92'
NAD+SU+I008::92'
CUX+1:EUR:9'
LIN+1++PART-12345:IN'
QTY+21:1000:PCE'
DTM+2:202602011000:203'
UNS+S'
UNT+15+1'
UNZ+1+REF12345']]>
                </Payload>
            </PurchaseOrder>
        </n0:PurchaseOrderERPRequest_In>
    </soapenv:Body>
</soapenv:Envelope>

Header:  UNB+UNOA:2+EXT.EDI:ZZ+SAP+260114:1830+REF12345'

Company Dummy:

I already setup the system and communication channel.

The indentifiers from the company

Indentifiers from the partner:

Created the agreement and active the agreement:

Agrement with MIG Sender, MAG and MIG Receiver:

The receiver channel in SAP basicalling I'm sending the result of the mapping in another endpoint in SAP CPI.

Agreement unic ID from trading partner:

SOAP-ODETTE_EDIFACT--D.96A S3-EXT.EDI-ZZ----EXT.EDI-ZZ----ORDERS - Wrong, it's always failed in the 2 Iflow Stantard 

Error:

javax.script.ScriptException: java.lang.Exception: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Partner ID SAP_TPM_467257935cff5475cbc45359b4ba5bc7 is not available.

It's like opositive way but I can't find the reason.

Partner Directory Lookup Keys:

SOAP-ODETTE_EDIFACT--D.96A S3-EXT.EDI-ZZ----SAP-----ORDERS

Agremment Plan ID:

SOAP-ODETTE_EDIFACT--D.96A S3-EXT.EDI-ZZ----EXT.EDI-ZZ----ORDERS

Someone could provide me support ?

Regards,

Viana
